channel.title: Which you rather do?
channel.description: What you rather do stay in school or be at home playing video game, go online or for some watch porn I personitly prefer playing game, school suck why do we need to go? can't they just dump us in college without going to school, i think elemetry school was the LONGEST year of my life

item.title: Which you rather do?
item.dc:creator: @victor_ZOLO victor_ZOLO
item.description:
@victor_ZOLO wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:44, topic:144562”][quote author=Bobby link=topic=198161.msg1770300#msg1770300 date=1190353180]

I failed algerbra in 8th grade last year on purpose cuz i didnt want to do calus, so im doing alegbra 1 geomary alebra 2 and trigeomary.

That is the stupidest reason to fail a class ever.

just don’t take calulus then. you have a choice… failing on purpose is a new low
[/quote]He didn’t fail on purpose, he was too busy playing games in his concealed basement where light couldn’t reach him to do the work. So he failed. Now hes telling us he did it on purpose.[/quote]
i wasn’t playing game i was punished for the entire school year and i spend most of ym time skating

Read full topic

item.title: Which you rather do?
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

for half the year and then 4 differnt classes for the rest of the year. in middle school you take 6 classes and on monday, you take all of them tuesday is odd classes (1st, 3rd and 5th) and wendnesday is evens then thrursaday odss and on firday, evens again

item.title: Which you rather do?
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

are highg school does 4 classes every day for a halfthe year, and then a differnt 4 classes for the rest of the year. fora total of 8 classes a year
the other high school takes 6 classes over the whole year and just switches off between the even classes and the odd classes every day.

item.title: Which you rather do?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

exe626:

At my school, for my 3rd and final math class, I’m doing a bit of Geo-B and Trig 1. Thats average and most people take it. In the first year you take Algebra 1/2 through out the year, the next year you do Geo-A and fundamentals of trig, then you move on. I though that was a lot. Your doing Calculus though, I bet thats hard as fuck.

That’s pretty freaky. As a freshman I took Geometry, as a sophomore I took Algebra 2, as a junior I took AP Calculus AB, and as a senior I’m taking AP Calculus BC.

It’s really w/e, because you’re going to learn it eventually, and your mind is mostly developed already so as long as you have a strong foundation, you’ll be good.

Read full topic

i don’t need to much reviewing, i got all of the hard teachers last year who gave lots of work, but taought alot, so i guess im good to go for this year.

item.title: Which you rather do?
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Rich white kids have other people do their school work.

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:25, topic:144562”]I’m pretty sure rich white kids wouldn’t want to learn Calculus any more than poor white kids.[/quote]At my school, for my 3rd and final math class, I’m doing a bit of Geo-B and Trig 1. Thats average and most people take it. In the first year you take Algebra 1/2 through out the year, the next year you do Geo-A and fundamentals of trig, then you move on. I though that was a lot. Your doing Calculus though, I bet thats hard as fuck.

[quote=“Bobby, post:26, topic:144562”]well i guess the standardized testing is lieing.
anyway its cause here in my 'hood the parents have time to help ther kids, and speak english. in the other 'hood, they don’t speak english at home and there parents don’t have time to help them, since they have to work at lower paying jobs.[/quote]You have parents who help you with school work? I haven’t seen my dad in over 7 years, and my mom is never home. Lucky you.

Read full topic

item.title: Which you rather do?
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:27, topic:144562”][quote author=Bobby link=topic=198161.msg1768250#msg1768250 date=1190261531]
well i guess the standardized testing is lieing.
anyway its cause here in my 'hood the parents have time to help ther kids, and speak english. in the other 'hood, they don’t speak english at home and there parents don’t have time to help them, since they have to work at lower paying jobs.
[/quote]

Standardized testing doesn’t measure shit. And it certainly doesn’t measure how much a kid wants to learn a subject.

Yes, and in my rich white neighborhood, my parents don’t help me with stuff, nor do they primarily speak English.

Way to completely incorrectly stereotype.[/quote]your rich white neighborhood is differnt from mine then.

Read full topic

item.title: Which you rather do?
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

ThugLife:

I am in my last year of school, and basically all we are doing is going over the same stuff we have been doing since we was in primary school (“elementary” as some of you would call it), so basically i think we should be able to stay at home revise a bit and go in just for our GSCE’s.

oh you must go to a bad school. i go to a good school.

Read full topic
